description:
PSA: This Course will no longer be available June 30th 2016 onwards
                            Coursera announced that they will be shutting off their old platform on June 30th. Over  400 courses that are part
                                of the old stack will be no longer be available. You can find the  complete list here.
                            
                            

                            
                                Read this guide to learn how to download this course before the old platform shuts down. 

                                The guide provides two ways to download the courses - Chrome Plugin and Python Script. Depending on which method you use, check the appropriate sections below for further details.
                            
                            
                            
                                To download this course you need to be enrolled in the course.
                                                                    You can enroll for the course here:
                                    https://www.coursera.org/course/scicontentsurvey
                                                            

                            Chrome Plugin

                                                            You can download the course materials for this course by visiting the following url (you need to be logged in):
                                                                        https://class.coursera.org/scicontentsurvey-001/lecture
                                
                            
                            Python Script
                            
                                                                For the python script to work you will need a class name. Pick one from below:
                                                                    scicontentsurvey-001
                                
                                
                                If more than one class name below, pick the last one. If the script fails, pick the one above that and try again. Not all of these class names are guranteed to work.


                            






                        
                    
                    A revolution is underway in science classrooms. The demands of the new workplace and the ready access to information afforded by new technologies have radically changed the way we define a scientifically literate society. More than ever teachers need professional development that provides them with the resources they need and empowers them to take the action required to build classrooms where the next generation of scientifically literate students will flourish. Inquiry Science Learning: Perspectives and Practices consists of four courses, each designed to address a different strand in the development of skills teachers need to meet the demands of their career, including the following.Science LeadershipTechniques for SuccessScience ContentStudent-Centered InquiryIn this third course we will focus on helping teachers explore their own and their students misconceptions over a broad array of topics within science and engineering.

                                            Syllabus
                        The specific content explored by each participant will be determined by the needs and interests of that participant. Each week, however, there will be a focus as described below.Week 1: Misconceptions in Physical ScienceWeek 2: Misconceptions in Earth/Space ScienceWeek 3: Misconceptions in Life ScienceWeek 4: Misconceptions in Engineering
title: Inquiry Science Learning: Perspectives and Practices 3 - Science Content Survey
instructors: Lara Arch, Chris Thompson, Lisa Webber and Jarrett Whitaker
